title: Statistical methods; what, when and why?

_resources.title: Resources
_resources.description: View resources for this course by clicking here.

_resourcesItems.title: Reliability, repeatability, and reproducibility: analysis of measurement errors in continuous variables
_resourcesItems.description: Bartlett, J.W. and Frost, C. (2008), Reliability, repeatability, and reproducibility: analysis of measurement errors in continuous variables. Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol, 31: 466-475.

_resourcesItems.title: Statistical methods for assessing agreement between two methods of clinical measurement.
_resourcesItems.description: Bland JM, Altman DG. Statistical methods for assessing agreement between two methods of clinical measurement. Lancet. 1986 Feb 8;1(8476):307-10. PMID: 2868172.

_resourcesItems.title: Ophthalmic statistics note 6: effect sizes matter
_resourcesItems.description: Cook JA, Bunce C, Doré CJ, et al. Ophthalmic statistics note 6: effect sizes matter. British Journal of Ophthalmology 2015;99:580-581.

_resourcesItems.title: Evidence-based optometry - how to get started, Viewpoint.
_resourcesItems.description: Gjelle, W. by J.V.B. (2021) Evidence-based optometry - how to get started, Viewpoint.

_resourcesItems.title: A dirty dozen: twelve p-value misconceptions
_resourcesItems.description: Goodman S. A dirty dozen: twelve p-value misconceptions. Semin Hematol. 2008 Jul;45(3):135-40. doi: 10.1053/j.seminhematol.2008.04.003. Erratum in: Semin Hematol. 2011 Oct;48(4):302. PMID: 18582619.

_resourcesItems.title: The statistical versus clinical significance debate.
_resourcesItems.description: LeFort SM. The statistical versus clinical significance debate. Image J Nurs Sch. 1993 Spring;25(1):57-62. doi: 10.1111/j.1547-5069.1993.tb00754.x. PMID: 8240480.

_resourcesItems.title: Implementation of evidence‐based practice in optometry, Clinical and Experimental Optometry
_resourcesItems.description: Philip J Anderton (2007) Implementation of evidence‐based practice in optometry, Clinical and Experimental Optometry, 90:4, 238-243, DOI: 10.1111/j.1444-0938.2007.00153.x

_resourcesItems.title: Common pitfalls in statistical analysis: Clinical versus statistical significance.
_resourcesItems.description: Ranganathan P, Pramesh CS, Buyse M. Common pitfalls in statistical analysis: Clinical versus statistical significance. Perspect Clin Res. 2015 Jul-Sep;6(3):169-70. doi: 10.4103/2229-3485.159943. PMID: 26229754; PMCID: PMC4504060.

_resourcesItems.title: Comparison of intraocular pressure measurements with the portable PT100 noncontact tonometer and goldmann applanation tonometry, Clinical Ophthalmology
_resourcesItems.description: Sarwat Salim, Daniel J Linn, James R Echols II & Peter A Netland (2009)Comparison of intraocular pressure measurements with the portable PT100 noncontact tonometer and goldmann applanation tonometry, Clinical Ophthalmology, 3:, 341-344, DOI: 10.2147/opth.s5537

_resourcesItems.title: Statistical vs clinical significance: Are medical trials being misinterpreted?
